1011.quoteDoc: Terms of Service and License Agreement
1011.quoteText: You are solely responsible for all activity in connection with access to the Site and/or Services through your account or using your password, and for the security of your computer systems, and in no event shall Grammarly be liable for any loss or damages relating to such activity.
1011.title: You are responsible for all activity in your account

tosdr.case: You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account and for the activities on your account

1093.title: Grammarly does not notify users before being involved in a merger, sale, or acquisition

tosdr.case: may sell your data in merger
tosdr.tldr: Grammarly does not inform users before being involved in a merger, sale, or acquisition. They do, however, notify users via email and post a notice on their site regarding any choices you may have regarding your personal information.

1103.quoteText: Grammarly uses cookies and similar technologies, including tracking pixels and web beacons, to collect usage and analytic data that helps us provide our Site, Software, and/or Services to you, as well as to help deliver ads for relevant Grammarly products and services to you when you visit certain pages on the Site and then visit certain third-party sites.
1103.title: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.

tosdr.case: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.
tosdr.tldr: Grammarly uses third-party cookies to track your preferences and profile information, as well as general usage and volume stats, which don't include personal information. The web beacons are used along with cookies to analyze how their site is used, and to gauge how effective their customer communications and marketing campaigns are. For example, they know how many users access a specific page and which links they clicked on.

1471.quoteDoc: Terms of Service and License Agreement
1471.quoteText: You shall be solely responsible for the security and proper use of all user IDs, passwords or other security devices used in connection with the Site and/or the Services, and shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that they are kept confidential and secure, are used properly and are not disclosed to or used by any other person or entity.
1471.title: You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account and for the activities on your account

tosdr.case: You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account and for the activities on your account
tosdr.tldr: Grammarly not responsible for unauthorized access

1481.quoteDoc: Terms of Service and License Agreement
1481.quoteText: If Grammarly updates or revises this Agreement, Grammarly will notify you either by email to your most recently provided email address, by posting the updated or revised Terms of Service and End User License Agreement on the Site or by any other manner chosen by Grammarly in its commercially reasonable discretion.
1481.title: Terms may be changed any time at their discretion, without notice to the user

tosdr.case: Terms may be changed any time at their discretion, without notice to the user
tosdr.tldr: This is very vaguely defined and can basically mean "We post it somewhere and it will count as notification". I doubt this can be counted as "notification".

4927.quoteDoc: Terms of Service and License Agreement
4927.quoteText: By uploading or entering any User Content, you give Grammarly (and those it works with) a nonexclusive, worldwide, royalty-free and fully-paid, transferable and sublicensable, perpetual, and irrevocable license to copy, store and use your User Content (and, if you are an Authorized User, your Enterprise Subscriber’s User Content) in connection with the provision of the Software and the Services and to improve the algorithms underlying the Software and the Services.
4927.title: This service can use your content for all their existing and future services

tosdr.case: This service can use your content for all their existing and future services
tosdr.tldr:
As per the Grammarly's "Terms of Service and License Agreement," accessed 2018-10-31, "By uploading or entering any User Content, you give Grammarly (and those it works with) a nonexclusive, worldwide, royalty-free and fully-paid, transferable and sublicensable, perpetual, and irrevocable license to copy, store and use your User Content (and, if you are an Authorized User, your Enterprise Subscriber’s User Content) in connection with the provision of the Software and the Services and to improve the algorithms underlying the Software and the Services."

A perpetual, irrevocable license that is transferable and sublicensable use user content in a vague way isn't necessary. (The "provision of the Software and the Services" isn't defined or limited.)
